properties.description: The first Hartford Public High School building was dedicated in 1847, and located on the northwest corner of Asylum Avenue and Ann Street. Its Classical Department absorbed the existing Hartford Grammar School.
HPHS relocated to a larger Neo-Gothic building on Hopkins Street and Asylum Avenue in 1869. The building was enlarged in 1877 but destroyed by a fire in 1882.

The Hopkins Street building was reconstructed on the same site in 1883, with its facade facing east [check this]. The building was enlarged in 1897 to add a manual training facility. In 1914, another building was added on Broad Street for industrial and business courses.

HPHS relocated to Forest Street in 1963, and the Hopkins Street building was demolished in 1964 to make room for the East-West Highway, known today as Interstate I-84. The Forest Street building was renovated from 2004 to 2007.
